function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inability to distinguish the effectiveness of Non-Pharmaceutical Interventions (NPIs) on SARS-CoV-2 transmission and COVID-19 dynamics","Impact":"Lack of clarity on the impact of specific NPIs hinders future preparedness and response plans","Mitigation":"Conducting detailed studies using mechanistic models and regression analysis to assess the impact of individual NPIs","Technologies":"Mechanistic modeling, time-series regression, and advanced machine learning approaches","People":"Research institutes, public health agencies","Owner":"Research institutes, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Difficulty in disentangling the impact of individual NPIs due to non-random allocation and dependency on the state of the epidemic","Impact":"Challenges in accurately assessing the impact of specific NPIs on transmission rates","Mitigation":"Utilizing advanced statistical techniques to account for non-random allocation and state-dependent impact of NPIs","Technologies":"Time-series regression, semi-mechanistic models, and advanced machine learning approaches","People":"Epidemiologists, data scientists","Owner":"Epidemiologists, data scientists"},{"Description":"Potential confusion bias in effect estimation due to differences in behavior and adherence levels across various populations","Impact":"Risk of inaccurate estimation of NPI effectiveness due to behavioral and adherence variations","Mitigation":"Limiting studies to specific regions to avoid potential confusion bias and accounting for behavioral and adherence factors in analysis","Technologies":"Statistical methods for bias adjustment, stratified analysis","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians","Owner":"Epidemiologists, public health agencies"}]}
